clinical_study.brief_title: Gentamicin Treatment Prior to Schwannoma Surgery - Residual Function
clinical_study.official_title: Gentamicin Treatment Prior to Vestibular Schwannoma Surgery in Patients With Definite Remaining Vestibular Function

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine whether vestibular and postural compensation following schwannoma surgery is improved by ablating remaining vestibular function prior to surgery, through gentamicin injections in the middle ear.

detailed_description.textblock: The residual function of the vestibular system before surgery differs considerably between patients, due to extent and influence of tumor growth, resulting in varying spectra of post-surgery illness as well as vestibular symptoms. An acute unilateral vestibular deafferentation (uVD) (if significant vestibular function remains prior to surgery) invariably results in severe nausea and vertigo. The nausea/vertigo induced by surgery and sudden uVD both can impede vestibular compensation processes and in extension, also the need for rehabilitation. The vestibular PREHAB protocol was developed in order to address this problem and to ensure an enhanced and sufficient rehabilitation. The protocol encompass treating patients that have measurable vestibular function before surgery with intratympanic gentamicin injections, thus producing gradually a uVD over a period of 3-4 weeks, whilst performing daily vestibular exercises before and after the gentamicin treatment. Through this procedure the sensory trauma is separated from the surgical trauma, making it possible for vestibular compensation to ensue as the vestibular function gradually decline from gentamicin toxicity, unencumbered by any depression of central nervous function that might result from schwannoma surgery or the acute stages of an uVD.

primary_outcome.measure: Differences and changes of postural control following surgery, compared to before surgery
primary_outcome.time_frame: At first vestibular assessment at the time for inclusion and 6 months after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Postural control assessed with posturography during a sensory conflict

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences of duration of hospital stay
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After surgery for the duration of the hospital stay up to two weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Hospital stay required before patients can be discharged

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences of subjective well being after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Daily subjective assessment of perceived vertigo/dizziness after surgery and gentamicin treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of subjective well being after gentamicin treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediate time after gentamicin installation (2 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Daily subjective assessment of perceived vertigo/dizziness after gentamicin treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At first vestibular assessment and 2 weeks after gentamicin installation
secondary_outcome.description: Measuring hearing levels (pure tone hearing and speech discrimination) before and after gentamicin treatment to determine possible detrimental effect on hearing

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in the level of stress after surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily after surgery for the duration of the hospital stay up to 2 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Daily Measures of cortisol in the saliva after surgery during the time patients are admitted to the hospital

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences of perceived dizziness after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of level of impact of dizziness in daily life, measured with Dizziness Handicap Inventory (DHI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences of level of anxiety and depression
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of level of anxiety and depression after surgery, enquiry with Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of level of perceived dizziness after gentamicin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At first vestibular assessment and 6 weeks after gentamicin installation
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of level of impact of dizziness in daily life, measured with Dizziness Handicap Inventory (DHI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences of changes in levels of perceived dizziness after surgery as compared to before surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At first vestibular assessment and 6 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of level of impact of dizziness in daily life, measured with Dizziness Handicap Inventory (DHI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of spontaneous nystagmus after surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 after surgery and for duration of either spontaneous nystagmus or hospital stay (up to 2 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: To measure spontaneous nystagmus after surgery and its direction as a sign of vestibular deafferentation or central nervous damage

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in vestibular compensation after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Vestibular function tests, v-HIT, calorics and otolith tests to determine compensation after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of vestibular function after gentamicin treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Vestibular function tests, v-HIT, calorics and otolith tests to determine compensation and function after gentamicin treatment

other_outcome.measure: Differences of needed sick-leave from work and leisure activities
other_outcome.description: Time to return to normal daily activities after surgery, both job-related and leisure activities

arm_group.description: Installation of gentamicin in the middle ear 6 weeks prior to surgery + rehabilitation exercises before and after both treatment and surgery. Rehabilitation exercises are not considered to be an intervention since their benign impact on vestibular/postural compensation is well documented, and exclusion from exercises would not be approved by the ethical board.

Rehabilitation exercises before and after surgery. Rehabilitation exercises are not considered to be an intervention since their benign impact on vestibular/postural compensation is well documented, and exclusion from exercises would not be approved by the ethical board.

intervention.description: Intratympanic installation of gentamicin 2-4 times depending on the efficacy of vestibular deafferentation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosed with vestibular schwannoma and surgical treatment is advised
- remaining vestibular function
Exclusion Criteria:
- impaired decision making
- no remaining vestibular function
- signs of central nervous dysfunction
- neurofibromatosis
- Patients are advised not to participate in the gentamicin arm but encouraged to participate in the 'non-gentamicin' arm:
- when hearing is better than 30decibel (dB) i pure tone average (500, 1000, 2000, 3000/4000 Hz) and speech discrimination better than 70% -when the neurosurgeon aim at hearing preservation surgery and do not want to risk gentamicin- associated hearing loss
